programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads are forced to take a well-known British trouble-maker under their collective wing, but his presence in the hut soon leads to friction and a beating for Neville. Michael Elphick guest stars in the popular comedy drama.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Jupiter is big, very dangerous and has moons as big as planets, but the more we learn we must conclude this giant is less of a planet and more of a failed star.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: The political divide between sisters Jessica and Diane Mitford, one of whom abandoned high society to embrace communism while the other married fascist leader Oswald Mosely.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: A famous attempt to fake the missing link between ape and man, which went unquestioned for 40 years with serious consequences for the study of evolution.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

credits.director: Don Maddox features in the footage
he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Ash Park prepares for a visit from the Prime Minister and his wife in support of George's election campaign, and James begins to learn how to relax in public with Harry.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: On the day of the Prime Minister's visit to Ash Park, Regina is in her element making preparations and George is happy to make a speech to his supporters gathered at the gates. Sarah, knowing that she would not be welcome, awaits Harry at Inverness hospital from his transfer from Sydney. Elizabeth, meanwhile, has to time her return home with military precision.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: Last Laugh in Vegas
programme.desc: Comedians Cannon and Ball, Bernie Clifton, Kenny Lynch and Mick Miller, join forces with musicians Bobby Crush, Jess Conrad, Anita Harris and actress Su Pollard to stage their dream gig in Nevada. For two weeks they'll live together, explore the city and rehearse with Las Vegas producer Frank Marino, preparing for the biggest performance of their lives in one of the area's most iconic theatres.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: We Love All Boy Anthems
programme.desc: The boys are back in town! Check out all the hits from some of our favourite men in pop music.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Following Nasa's discovery that something strange is on Saturn's largest moon, experts investigate the possibility of alien life feeding on electric atmosphere.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.desc: A missing mummified body could re-write the history of Abraham Lincoln's assassination, as Ramy Romany investigates whether John Wilkes Booth actually escaped.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: A buried monument offers new evidence about a huge Biblical mystery. A giant shadow engulfs the Pacific Ocean, and strange circular lake is home to unearthly life.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: An examination of the Teutul family history, with Paul Sr reminiscing about his childhood and the start of his career at Orange County Ironworks.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: A storm threatens to shut down Era Alaska's operations, Ben Pedersen faces dangerous conditions and Erik Snuggerud resorts to drastic measures to deliver medicine to a village.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the sticky task of tofu making, and finds out what happens when a TV monitor is destroyed.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind carbon dioxide cartridges, pretzels, scissor lifts and skating rinks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How professional ice-hockey players' sticks are manufactured, as well as treadmills and baby shoes.

programme.title: The World's Fattest Man - A Love Story
programme.desc: The former 'World's Fattest Man' Paul Mason seeks a surgeon to remove the excess skin after his 700lbs weight loss. As he struggles through his weight-loss journey, he finds love.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic detectives demonstrate how killers who spill even a drop of blood always run the risk of leaving themselves open to identification. Plus, an incident involving a woman struck by a train.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the armed robbery of a Seattle bank, in which one of the gunmen was killed by police fire and the other escaped after assaulting a family.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Lieutenant Scott uncovers an illegal cache of constrictor snakes, raising concerns that the deadly predators are being traded, and an abused dog fights for its life.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour hijacks an appointment, leaving consultant Nicky to ensure the bride's voice is heard. Meanwhile, another bride tries to convince her sister to wear red.
